intro: Monandraira patula, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family, characterized by its unique and striking floral structure. The plant features a slender, upright stem with a single, showy flower that typically blooms in the rainy season. Its flowers are often pale green or white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Monandraira patula is considered a conservation concern.
